Parsing newick formatted phylogenetic tree

July 25, 2018

Joanna and I are headed up to Northern Ireland today, Lydia (Joanna’s sister) is getting married. Today I was working on some Java code I wrote a few years ago to parse a Newick formatted phylogenetic tree. Whilst it is fresh in my mind, I thought I’d write a quick post - also the bus takes ages!! A phylogenetic tree, describing the ancestral relationships between a set of nucleotide sequences, can be stored can be stored in a Newick format. A detailed description of this format can be found here. The Newick format looks like this:
